chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic A. Hilburn-Pein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Dangerous Weapon-Person < 18, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ec/pc: DA, Atty De La Rosa, JESO (7/13/22--ma)
w/ ccs
Order Firearms Destroy

[ml] Case called at 3:58PM
Defendant Dominic A. Hilburn-Pein in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the Defense, the Court cancels the warrant authorization.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered as to Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--no possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--any other assessment, treatment, or counseling
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming
--DNA sample and surcharge
--payment of fees and other costs

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $443.00] The Court grants the Defendant thirty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will a civil judgment being entered.

Days credit for time already served: 3 days [The Court advises that it will amend the JOC if Att De La Rosa submits a compelling finding.]

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for expungement for reasons stated on the record.
The Court orders the firearm to be destroyed along with any ammunition found in or around the firearm. DA Hall is to submit a proposed order for this. 

The Court orders the Defendant to appear before the Jefferson County Probation Office no later than 3:00PM on 07/08/2022.
  
recess 4:15PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 8:38am 
Defendant Dominic A. Hilburn-Pein appears by telephone. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant has unexpectedly telephoned in for this hearing, indicating that he was unable to get transportation. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that a resolution of the case has been reached; he requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing. 
The Court authorizes a Warrant but stays its issuance until the date of the next hearing. 
recess 8:42am

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on July 7th at 3:30pm--JA note in comments that a warrant has been authorized but stayed to this date

Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 9:09AM
Defendant Dominic A. Hilburn-Pein in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This file is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing, however the Defense advises that it will be waiving Preliminary Hearing. The Court proceeds with Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:

Mr. Hilburn-Pein waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to both counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

recess 9:13AM

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 05/25 at 3:00PM   (2) Status Conference on 06/23 at 8:30AM with in person appearances

records.addlTxt: Att De La Rosa
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Witness 1
--submit to the booking process prior to being released from the Jefferson County Jail, if not already accomplished

[ml] Case called at 1:18PM
Defendant Dominic A. Hilburn-Pein appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.
The Court finds Probable Cause to exist on the four corners of the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires a $1,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Witness 1
--submit to the booking process prior to being released from the Jefferson County Jail, if not already accomplished

recess 1:25PM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 05/10 at 9:00AM
